article.title: Panchromatic Hubble Andromeda Treasury XVIII. The High-mass Truncation of the Star Cluster Mass Function

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red line in the left panel of Figure 2 represent?
choices: The observed, completeness-corrected cluster mass distribution.
The median-selected Schechter function fit to the data.
A power-law fit to the data.
The expected cluster mass distribution if there were no high-mass truncation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the different colors (blue and red) in Figure 3 represent?
choices: Different star formation rates.
Different galaxy types.
Different age ranges for the analyzed clusters.
Different mass ranges for the analyzed clusters.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main conclusion drawn from the power-law fit shown in Figure 4?
choices: The power-law fit accurately describes the observed cluster mass distribution.
The power-law fit underpredicts the number of massive clusters.
The power-law fit overpredicts the number of massive clusters.
The power-law fit indicates a steeper than canonical slope for the mass function.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the right panel in Figure 5 demonstrate?
choices: The Schechter function provides a statistically better fit to the observed cluster mass distribution compared to the power-law function.
The power-law function accurately predicts the observed number of massive clusters.
The age of the clusters doesn\'t impact the overall shape of the mass function.
There is no statistically significant difference between the Schechter and power-law fits.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main trend shown in Figure 6?
choices: Mc decreases with increasing ΣSFR.
Mc increases with increasing ΣSFR.
There is no correlation between Mc and ΣSFR.
Mc remains constant across different ΣSFR.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main implication of the overlapping Mc values for young and globular cluster systems, as shown in Figure 7?
choices: It suggests that globular clusters form through a fundamentally different mechanism compared to young clusters.
It strengthens the idea that globular cluster formation at high redshift might have followed similar relations to young cluster formation at the present day.
It proves that environmental factors have no impact on the formation of globular clusters.
It demonstrates that there is no correlation between Mc and star formation history.
